panels.description: This panel requires the scopes 'cluster', 'namespace' and 'workload'.
panels.name: Brokers Expected

panels.description: It includes the size of all replicas of a topic.
panels.name: Topic Size

advancedQueries.query: sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, topic)(kafka_topic_partition_current_offset{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, topic=~$topic}) - sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, topic)(kafka_topic_partition_oldest_offset{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, topic=~$topic})

panels.description:
The number of messages in a topic is calculated with "currentOffset - oldestOffset".
This is only true for topics with 'compaction' disabled, since compacted topics might have deleted messages in the middle.
panels.name: Topic Messages

panels.description: It includes the size of all replicas of a topic.
panels.name: Top 10 Biggest Topics

panels.description: If Kafka is running out of disk space, it's probably caused by one of these topics.
panels.name: Top 10 Topics Highest Size Increase

panels.description: These partitions don’t have an active leader and are hence not writable or readable.
panels.name: Offline Partitions

panels.description: The under ISR (In-Sync Replicated) partitions will be unavailable to producers who use acks=all.
panels.name: Under ISR Partitions

panels.markdownSource:
# Quota Stats
Kafka has the (optional) ability to enforce quotas on requests to control the Broker resources used by clients (Producers and Consumers).

Quotas can be applied to (user, client-id), user or client-id groups.

Each client can utilize this quota per Broker before it gets throttled. Throttling means that the client will need to wait some time before being able to Produce or Consume messages again.
panels.name: Quota Stats

panels.description: Kafka must have 1 Active Controller or "leader".
panels.name: Partition Leadership per Broker

panels.description: Kafka must have 1 Active Controller or "leader".
panels.name: Active Controllers

panels.description: Kafka must have 1 Active Controller or "leader".
panels.name: Active Controllers

displayInfo.displayName: Partition < ConsumerGroup < Topic < Workload < Namespace < Cluster

advancedQueries.query: sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, consumergroup, topic, partition)(kafka_consumergroup_lag{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, topic=~$topic, consumergroup=~$consumer_group})

panels.description: Lag can increase when a Consumer stops consuming, when it fails to process a message and continuously retries to process it, or when the Consumer consumption rate is lower than the Producer production rate.
panels.name: ConsumerGroup Lag

advancedQueries.query: sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, kube_pod_name, user)(kafka_server_producer_user_byterate{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, user=~$user})

displayInfo.displayName: Client-Id < User < Pod < Workload < Namespace < Cluster

advancedQueries.query: sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, kube_pod_name, user, client_id)(kafka_server_producer_user_client_byterate{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, user=~$user, client_id=~$client_id})

panels.name: Producer Rate by User and Client-Id
panels.nullValueDisplayText: No Producers using user and client-id.

advancedQueries.query: sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, kube_pod_name, client_id)(kafka_server_consumer_client_byterate{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, client_id=~$client_id})

panels.description: Time taken by requests from Brokers that are the followers of a partition to get new data.
panels.name: Fetch Follower Request Time

advancedQueries.query: sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, kube_pod_name, client_id)(kafka_server_producer_client_byterate{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, client_id=~$client_id})

sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, kube_pod_name, client_id)(kafka_server_producer_client_throttle_time{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, client_id=~$client_id})

sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, kube_pod_name, client_id)(kafka_server_consumer_client_throttle_time{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, client_id=~$client_id})

sum by(kube_cluster_name, kube_namespace_name, kube_workload_name, kube_pod_name, user)(kafka_server_producer_user_throttle_time{kube_cluster_name=~$cluster, kube_namespace_name=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload, user=~$user})

panels.name: Consumer ThrottleTime by User and Client-Id

panels.description: ZooKeeper client is currently disconnected from the ensemble. The client lost its previous connection to a server and it is currently trying to reconnect. The session is not necessarily expired. Note that this metric tells you if the broker is disconnecting, but not if ZooKeeper is down.
panels.name: ZooKeeper Disconnections

panels.description:
The ZooKeeper session has expired. When a session expires, we can have leader changes and even a new controller. It is important to keep an eye on the number of such events across a Kafka cluster and if the overall number is high, then there are a few recommendations:
- Check the health of your network
- Check for garbage collection issues and tune it accordingly
- If necessary, increase the session time out by setting the value of zookeeper.session.timeout.ms.
panels.name: ZooKeeper Expired Sessions

panels.description: ZooKeeper client is connected to the ensemble and ready to execute operations.
panels.name: ZooKeeper Sync Connections

panels.description: An attempt to connect to the ensemble failed because the client has not provided correct credentials.
panels.name: ZooKeeper Authentication Failures

panels.description: Client has successfully authenticated using SASL.
panels.name: ZooKeeper SASL Authentications

panels.description: The server the client is connected to is currently LOOKING, which means that it is neither FOLLOWING nor LEADING. Consequently, the client can only read the ZooKeeper state, but not make any changes (create, delete, or set the data of znodes).
panels.name: ZooKeeper Read-Only Connections
